Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2011 01:50PM Jacqu79 wrote: Thanks TifJ!  Now I have a vision of a horse galloping around wearing a huge pad lol!  I had just finished my period a few days before my surgery, but started again during surgery.  The nurses said it's quite common as our bodies are under a lot of stress at this time.  I didn't get any sexy panties for the first few days as I had a catheter and 2 drains in my groin, so they just stuck a pad to the bed!!!!   Couldn't believe it when I saw them doing it, but it worked very well as I wasn't moving much anyway!  I was embarassed at first, but the nurses were wonderful.  They're used to this sort of thing.  Good Luck Nancy, hope all goes well.x

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2011 10:06AM Jacqu79 wrote: Hi everyone! Well today I'm 13 days post op and feeling great!  I had my final drain removed today.  It was still draining quite high (100ml since Sunday) but my surgeon doesn't usually like to leave it in longer than 10 days due to infection risk, so has taken it out and is just keeping an eye on things incase I develop a seroma. I also had my dressings removed today, so this is the first time I've seen my new boobs and WOW!!!!!  I keep going for a peek in the mirror!  They're fantastic!  I'm not too sure about my abdominal scar yet, but it's still early days and things have to settle down a bit I guess.   Hope everyone else is doing well!  Thinking about y'all! Jacqueline.xxx
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2011 06:37PM Jacqu79 wrote: Hi there Paula, glad to hear you're recovering well!  I'm doing good too.  I've a few issues, but nothing major.  My abdomen wound has opened in one place about 3"long, but the rest of the wound is healing nicely.  The scars on my breasts are healing very well too and I'm also experiencing the itching sensation which I'm assuming is the healing taking place? I've also been getting "electric shock" type pains which I'm putting down to nerves healing.   I saw my PS last Thursday and I'd developed a seroma in my abdomen, so had to have it aspirated.  She removed 650mls of fluid from my tummy!!  I'm due back on Thursday to have it drained again and as it's swollen and distended I'm assuming there's quite a bit gathering there again!  The good thing is, my tummy is still numb, so I didn't feel a thing!  I'm also struggling to get comfortable to sleep  I seem to start off in bed, then wake up during the night (usually soaked with sweat!) and move on to the couch.  I can't wait to sleep on my side either! Hope everyone else is recovering well too. Jacqueline.xxx
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2010 04:56PM Jacqu79 wrote: Hi there everyone!  I'm booked in for a prophylactic bilateral mastectomy and immediate DIEP reconstruction on 20th Dec. I don't know if I should be posting on here.  I don't have cancer.  I've been advised to have surgery because my mum died from BC at the age of 31 and it turns out I'm BRCA2 positive.  I'd just like to wish everyone all the best.xxx

Posts.Content: Dec 28, 2010 05:43AM Jacqu79 wrote: Thanks for the good wishes everyone!   I'll be leaving in an hour to go to hospital.  My surgery is not until 7am tomorrow morning, but they want me there at 4pm today. (I'm in the UK, so a few hours ahead of you guys I think!). Paula66 I'll include you in my prayers too and I'm looking forward to when we're both back posting on here from the other side! Don't know when I'll be able to get back online as I'll be in hospital for 10-14 days, but I'll be thinking of everyone and wishing you all the best. Jacqueline.xxx
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Jan 8, 2011 07:14AM Jacqu79 wrote: Hi everyone! Just a quick post at the moment to say I'm now 10 days post bilateral mastectomy and DIEP reconstruction and I'm finally home!  All went well, though I don't think I'd prepared myself for just how major this surgery actually is!  I'm still exhausted!  I had 3 drains removed 4 days post op, but still have an abdomen drain in my groin which is at the moment is sitting at 80mls.  My surgeon doesn't usually let you leave hospital until they're all removed (they're removed once they drain below 50ml), but I was starting to go stir crazy, so she let me go home this morning, but I have to go back and get my drain checked and emptied tomorrow. I still haven't seen my new breasts properly as she keeps dressing on for 3/4 weeks!  They seem fuller than before, but I'm not sure if that's down to swelling, also my tummy isn't as flat as I expected it to be, but I'll have to wait and see how things look once the swelling goes down. Paula I'm glad everything went well for you and hope everyone else is ok. Jacqu.xxx
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2010 03:52AM Jacqu79 wrote: Hey ladies,  hope everyone had a lovely Christmas! Paula66, Wednesday is also the big day for me and while I thought I've been ready for it for a long time, I've been very weepy the past couple of days.  I'm also BRCA2+, my mum died aged 31 and 3 of her 1st cousins and 2 aunts have also had BC so although I don't have cancer, I've been advised to have a prophylactic mastectomy as my risk is high. I hope everything goes well for you on Wednesday and that you'll keep us updated afterwards. Good Luck! Jacqueline.x
